Thailand is obsessed with AI music slop

You will hear it in almost every taxi, retail store and coffee shop

It’s hard to notice at first but once you hear it you won’t unhear it

And it’s funny cos everyone in tech twitter bashes AI music

But 99% of the world doesn’t care

Yesterday I helped a founder figure out their content strategy.

One thing that stood out: they weren't keeping up with their space.

If you're building in public and want people to see you as an authority, you need to actually be one.

That means:
- Reading what's happening in

2 weeks ago my churn rate was 40%

Today it's 32.9% (down by over 7%)

Here's exactly how I got it down:

1. Talked to churned users and asked why they churned
2. Discovered the initial UX was too confusing
3. Added onboarding missions
4. In turn reduced the time to the "aha"

To build in public well you need to:

- Tell a story
- Be entertaining
- Stay consistent

Doing all of these will put you in the top 0.1%

Follower count does not matter.

What you post does.

Fine, here’s how to get out of 200 view jail on X:

- Find 5 people in your niche you like
- Reply one of their posts every day
- Post once every day
- Repeat for 2 months

This is the only way I'm getting through it:

(on repeat)

Feeling like you're under pressure is a privilege.

It means people expect something of you.

The alternative isn't as pretty.

Build to learn.

Then build to make money.

Then build to create something new or make an existing thing better, faster.

Then build something truly meaningful to you and make the world better.

Many people stop at step 2.
